summary: A severe increase in blood pressure which can damage blood vessels, cause organ damage and lead to a stroke.
name: hypertensive-emergency
title: Hypertensive Emergency

description: __Acute Myocarditis__ is most commonly caused by a viral infection, but can also be due to bacteria, medications, toxins or an autoimmune disease.
summary: Acute inflammation of the heart muscle. Most cases are mild but in some instances, damage to the muscle may lead to heart failure. Also known as __Inflammatory Cardiomyopathy.__
name: acute-myocarditis-(inflammatory-cardiomyopathy)
title: Acute Myocarditis (Inflammatory Cardiomyopathy)

description: __Tricuspid Insufficiency__ or __Tricuspid Regurgitation__ is either congenital (from birth) or acquired as a result of another disease. It can be caused by any process that causes enlargement of the right side of the heart, such as chronic lung disease, or by infection of the valve itself (*infective endocarditis*).
summary: A condition where the *tricuspid valve* in the right side of the heart does not close tightly. This allows blood to flow backwards from the bottom of the heart (ventricle) into the top of the heart (atrium). Also known as __Tricuspid Regurgitation.__
name: tricuspid-insufficiency-(tricuspid-regurgitation)
title: Tricuspid Insufficiency (Tricuspid Regurgitation)

description: __Subdural Hematomas__ are caused by injuries in which the veins on the surface of the brain are torn and a clot forms. The pressure created from continued bleeding can be life-threatening.
summary: A collection of blood between the brain and the brain's covering or *dura*. It is among the most dangerous head injuries. Also known as __SDH__ or __Subdural Hemorrhage__.
name: subdural-hematoma-(sdh-or-subdural-hemorrhage)
title: Subdural Hematoma (SDH or Subdural Hemorrhage)

description: The cause of __Wegener's Granulomatosis__ is unclear although it is an autoimmune disease.
summary: An autoimmune vasculitis or inflammation of small blood vessels, especially those in the nose, sinuses, ears, lungs and kidneys.
name: wegener's-granulomatosis-(granulomatosis-with-polyangiitis-or-gpa)
title: Wegener's Granulomatosis (Granulomatosis with Polyangiitis or GPA)

description: __Superficial Vein Thrombosis__ is caused by varicose veins, injuries to a vein (for example when taking bloods or in the placement of a cannula) or occasionally by a clotting disorder.
summary: Inflammation and clotting in the superficial veins (just under the skin). It typically occurs in the arms or legs, is generally short-term and heals without complications.
name: superficial-vein-thrombosis
title: Superficial Vein Thrombosis

description: The exact cause of a __Varicocele__ is unknown although it is thought to be the result of abnormalities in the veins to the testes.
summary: A common abnormal enlargement of the veins in the scrotum. It usually causes no symptoms but can cause discomfort. There is a small association with infertility which is rarely significant.
name: varicocele
title: Varicocele

description: __Subacute Sinusitis__ can be caused by infectious (bacterial, viral, or fungal) or noninfectious (allergic) agents.
summary: Sinus inflammation lasting 4-12 weeks. The symptoms are similar to *acute sinusitis,* however the duration of symptoms is much more prolonged.
name: subacute-sinusitis
title: Subacute Sinusitis

description: __Adenoid Hypertrophy__ is caused by infection with either bacteria or viruses. Epstein Barr Virus is a common cause of this enlargement in adults.
summary: Enlargement of the adenoids, infection-fighting tissue located in the back of the throat by the eustachian tube (the tube which drains the middle ear). This enlargement can lead to blockage of airflow through the nasal passages.
name: adenoid-hypertrophy
title: Adenoid Hypertrophy

description: __Vocal Cord Edema__ is most commonly caused by smoking, although *gastroesophageal reflux disease* and overuse of the voice can also trigger the condition.
summary: Swelling of the vocal cords which can result in hoarseness of the voice. Also known as __Reinke's Edema__.
name: vocal-cord-edema-(reinke's-edema)
title: Vocal Cord Edema (Reinke's Edema)

description: __Submandibular Sialadenitis__ is most commonly caused by a bacterial infection of the salivary gland after blockage of the opening of the salivary gland occurs. Virus or autoimmune causes are also possible.
summary: Inflammation affecting the salivary glands under the jaw. It can affect any of the salivary glands.
name: submandibular-sialadenitis
title: Submandibular Sialadenitis

description: __Xerostomia__ is not a disease but the symptom of many diseases or the side effect of many medications.
summary: Dryness in the mouth from either reduced or absent saliva.
name: xerostomia
title: Xerostomia

description: __Glossitis__ is caused by infection such as viruses, allergic reactions, low iron levels and trauma.
summary: Inflammation of the tongue.
name: glossitis
title: Glossitis

description: __Esophagitis__ can be caused by acid travelling up from the stomach, alcohol, medications and several other causes.
summary: Inflammation of the esophagus, the tube which carries food from the mouth to the stomach.
name: esophagitis
title: Esophagitis

description: __A Zenker's Diverticulum__ is caused by the tightness of a muscle located just below the voice box. Over time the tightness builds up pressure and leads to a bulge or pouch. Undigested food can get trapped in the diverticulum.
summary: A small pouch which develops at the junction of the lower part of the throat and the esophagus.
name: zenker's-diverticulum
title: Zenker's Diverticulum

description: __Perianal Abscesses__ are caused by anal glands getting blocked and becoming infected. They may be related with conditions such as diabetes, AIDS, Crohn's Disease and pregnancy.
summary: Painful collections of pus near the anus.
name: perianal-abscess-(anorectal-abscess)
title: Perianal Abscess (Anorectal Abscess)

name: rectal-prolapse
title: Rectal Prolapse

name: nephrotic-syndrome
title: Nephrotic Syndrome

name: acute-kidney-injury
title: Acute Kidney Injury

description: __Neurogenic Bladder__ can be congenital or a result of many neurologic diseases, such as *stroke*, *Parkinson's*, or *Multiple Sclerosis.*
summary: A condition where normal bladder function is impaired due to neurologic damage. It can be either overactive (spastic or hyper-reflexive with frequent contractions) or underactive (flaccid or hypotonic, rarely contracting).
name: neurogenic-bladder
title: Neurogenic Bladder

name: urethritis
title: Urethritis

description: __Chronic Prostatitis__ can be the result of a bacterial infection but there are also cases where the cause is not fully understood.
summary: Long-standing inflammation of the prostate gland.
name: chronic-prostatitis
title: Chronic Prostatitis

description: __Orchitis__ is generally caused by a sexually transmitted infection such as gonorrhea or chlamydia and responds fully to the appropriate treatment. Rarer causes include the mumps virus or complications of operations in this area.
summary: Inflammation of the testes, one or both.
name: orchitis
title: Orchitis

description: __Breast Abscesses__ are typically caused by a blocked breast duct or gland. It is more common in women who are breastfeeding but can occur in those who are not.
summary: A collection of pus or infection in the breast tissue.
name: breast-abscess
title: Breast Abscess

description: __Cervicitis__ is most often caused by sexually transmitted diseases but can also be from a bacterial overgrowth of normal bacteria or an allergic reaction.
summary: Inflammation or infection of the cervix.
name: cervicitis
title: Cervicitis

description: __Bacterial Vaginosis__ is caused by an overgrowth of bacteria in the vagina.
summary: A condition in which much larger numbers of bacteria grow inside the vagina than would normally be there. This can cause a strong-smelling, unpleasant odor and discharge.
name: bacterial-vaginosis
title: Bacterial Vaginosis

description: A __Rectocele__ is caused by an increase in pressure on the pelvic floor. Pregnancy, chronic constipation, obesity, and repetitive heavy lifting are all risk factors.
summary: When the front wall of the rectum bulges into the back wall of the vagina. A small prolapse (bulge) can be asymptomatic but larger ones can require surgical repair. Also known as __Posterior Vaginal Prolapse.__
name: rectocele-(posterior-vaginal-prolapse)---female
title: Rectocele (Posterior Vaginal Prolapse) - female

description: The exact cause of __Premenstrual Syndrome__ is unknown but hormonal changes trigger the symptoms.
summary: A collection of symptoms, both emotional and physical, relating to a woman's menstrual cycle. Most women have some symptoms, but for some women symptoms are severe enough to interfere with daily life.
name: premenstrual-syndrome-(pms)
title: Premenstrual Syndrome (PMS)

name: erythema-nodosum
title: Erythema Nodosum

name: scleroderma
title: Scleroderma

description: __Dermatomyositis__ is thought to be an autoimmune disease, where a body's immune system mistakenly attack normal cells.
summary: A connective tissue disease in which there is inflammation in the muscles and skin. Skin changes and muscle weakness often occur.
name: dermatomyositis
title: Dermatomyositis

name: crohn's-arthropathy
title: Crohn's Arthropathy

name: ankylosing-spondylitis
title: Ankylosing Spondylitis

description: __Osteomyelitis__ is caused by either a spread of infection to the bone through the blood or by direct contact to the bone through either surgery or fracture.
summary: An infection involving the bone and surrounding tissue. Any bone can become infected, although certain bones, such as the vertebrae, are more susceptible than others.
name: osteomyelitis
title: Osteomyelitis

description: __Polycystic Kidney Disease (PKD)__ is an inherited disorder.
summary: A disorder where numerous fluid-filled cysts grow in the kidneys. Over time it can lead to kidney failure. Also known as __PKD.__
name: polycystic-kidney-disease-(pkd)
title: Polycystic Kidney Disease (PKD)

name: klinefelter-syndrome-(ks-or-xxy-syndrome)
title: Klinefelter Syndrome (KS or XXY Syndrome)

description: The cause of __Essential Tremor__, or__ ET__, is unclear although about half of the cases run in families. It does worsen over time and in some cases can be severe.
summary: A nervous system disorder that causes involuntary movements and rhythmic shaking. It differs from Parkinson's as it is most often seen in the hands while using them. Also known as __ET__ or __Benign Essential Tremor.__
name: essential-tremor
title: Essential Tremor

description: Vehicle accidents and sports injuries are common causes of a __Concussion__. People with symptoms such as drowsiness, persistent vomiting, worsening headache, confusion, behaving strangely, limb weakness or tingling should seek medical attention to rule out a more serious cause.
summary: A condition that happens after a head injury. The syndrome leads to various temporary neurologic changes such as headaches, blurred vision or dizziness.
name: concussion-(brain-concussion)
title: Concussion (Brain Concussion)

description: __Peritonsillar Abscess__ can be caused by many kinds of bacteria, but *Streptococcus pyogenes* is the most common.
summary: A collection of pus located in between the tonsils and throat muscles.
name: peritonsillar-abscess
title: Peritonsillar Abscess

description: The cause of __Aspiration Pneumonia__ is bacteria from the mouth or stomach entering the lungs.
summary: A lung infection that occurs when food, saliva, or contents from the stomach pass through the vocal cords and into the lungs.
name: aspiration-pneumonia
title: Aspiration Pneumonia

description: Pneumonia, heart failure, cancer, or pulmonary embolism can lead to a __Pleural Effusion__.
summary: An abnormal collection of fluid between the thin layers of tissue (*pleura*) lining the lungs and the inner wall of the chest cavity. If the extra fluid gets infected, it's called an *empyema*.
name: pleural-effusion
title: Pleural Effusion

description: There are many causes of __Pericardial Effusion__, including infections, cancers, trauma, kidney failure, and certain medications.
summary: A collection of fluid in the *pericardium*, which is a sac that surrounds the heart. If left untreated, a __Pericardial Effusion__ can affect the heart's ability to pump blood.
name: pericardial-effusion
title: Pericardial Effusion

name: anaphylaxis
title: Anaphylaxis

description: __Unstable Angina__ is caused by inadequate blood flow through the *coronary arteries*, which supply blood to the heart muscle.
summary: Occurs when your heart muscle doesn't get enough oxygen-rich blood. More frequent, severe, and unpredictable than __Stable Angina__, it can occur with or without physical exertion, and rest or medicine may not relieve the pain.
name: unstable-angina
title: Unstable Angina

name: pericarditis
title: Pericarditis

description: There are many possible causes of __Pneumothorax__, including lung disease, medical procedures, or chest injury/trauma. Sometimes the cause of a __Pneumothorax__ isn't known.
summary: A buildup of air or gas in the *pleural space*, which is the area between the lungs and chest wall. It can lead to the collapse of lung tissue.
name: pneumothorax
title: Pneumothorax

description: __Septic Arthritis__ is typically caused by bacteria but can also be from a viral or fungal infection.
summary: An infection in a joint. Also known as __Infectious Arthritis__.
name: septic-arthritis-(infectious-arthritis)
title: Septic Arthritis (Infectious Arthritis)

description: __Trigeminal neuralgia__ seems to be caused by a problem in the contact between the blood vessel and the nerve. Normally no cause is found but it can be due to underlying conditions.
summary: Also known as Tic Douloureux, this is a disorder of the *Trigeminal nerve* (the fifth cranial nerve) causing intense pain shooting across one side of the face. Initially there are short, frequent attacks.
name: trigeminal-neuralgia-(tic-douloureux)
title: Trigeminal Neuralgia (Tic Douloureux)

description: The cause of __Cluster Headaches__ is unknown.
summary: Incredibly painful headaches that happen on one side of the head, usually near the eye. The headaches happen in a group, or cluster, usually around the same time each day. Cluster periods can last for weeks, after which the pain often ends as suddenly as it began.
name: cluster-headache
title: Cluster Headache

name: temporal-arteritis-(giant-cell-arteritis)
title: Temporal Arteritis (Giant Cell Arteritis)

name: balanitis
title: Balanitis

name: acute-angle-closure-glaucoma
title: Acute Angle-Closure Glaucoma

name: pilonidal-abscess
title: Pilonidal Abscess

description: __Bowel Obstructions__ are most commonly caused by severe constipation and hernias but can also be caused by a twist in the intestines, some inflammatory diseases, scar tissue from surgery, and certain types of cancer, such as cancers of the stomach, colon, and ovary. Rarely they may also be caused by conditions that affect the muscles of the intestine, such as paralysis.
summary: Also known as an *intestinal obstruction*, this is a partial or complete block of the small or large intestine that keeps food, liquid, gas, and stool from moving through the intestines in a normal way.
name: bowel-obstruction-(intestinal-obstruction)
title: Bowel Obstruction (Intestinal Obstruction)

description: The most common causes of __Pancreatitis__ are heavy alcohol use and gallstones entering and blocking the pancreatic duct that connects the *pancreas* to the small intestine.
summary: Inflammation of the *pancreas*, a large digestive gland behind the stomach that's connected to the small intestine.
name: pancreatitis
title: Pancreatitis

description: Ovarian masses, cysts or tumors increase the risk for an __Ovarian Torsion__ to occur.
summary: Occurs when the *ovary* twists on the ligament to which it is attached. This can cut off the blood supply to the *ovary* and render it nonfunctional.
name: ovarian-torsion
title: Ovarian Torsion

description: __Pelvic Inflammatory Disease__ is usually a complication of an untreated sexually transmitted infection, although non-sexually transmitted organisms can be responsible as well.
summary: An infection in the female reproductive organs. It usually involves the cervix, uterus, and/or ovaries but can spread into the abdomen as well.
name: pelvic-inflammatory-disease-(pid)
title: Pelvic Inflammatory Disease (PID)

description: The cause of __Endometriosis__ is unclear. Some women may not develop symptoms because the tissue is broken down and absorbed by their bodies. In other women, though, the tissue causes pain and can also make it difficult for some women to become pregnant.
summary: A condition in which *endometrial tissue*, the tissue that usually lines the uterus, grows in other parts of the body, like the ovaries, fallopian tubes, or pelvic cavity. Normally, *endometrial tissue* builds up in the uterus during the menstrual cycle and is shed at the end of it, leaving women\u2019s bodies during menstruation.
name: endometriosis
title: Endometriosis

name: ectopic-pregnancy-(tubal-pregnancy)
title: Ectopic Pregnancy (Tubal Pregnancy)

description: __Ketoacidosis__ is caused when ketone bodies accumulate, which leads to a buildup of acids and has a detrimental effect on the body. This commonly occurs in diabetics who cannot break down glucose due to insufficient insulin levels.
summary: A buildup of acid in the blood that occurs when glucose cannot be properly processed by the body. As the body tries to use other sources for fuel, *ketones* build up, making the blood acidic, and __Ketoacidosis__ occurs.
name: ketoacidosis
title: Ketoacidosis

description: The cause of __Atrial Fibrillation (Afib)__ is when the heart's electrical signals don't travel through the heart in a normal way. Instead, the atria and ventricles become disorganized and out of sync with each other.
summary: An irregular heartbeat in which the upper (atria) and lower (ventricles) chambers of the heart are contracting at different rates. Typically the rate of atrial contractions is much higher than the rate of the ventricular contractions.
name: acute-atrial-fibrillation-(afib)
title: Acute Atrial Fibrillation (AFib)

description: __Psoriatic Arthritis__ occurs when the body's immune system mistakenly attacks normal cells causing inflammation in the joints. Physical trauma or environmental factors may trigger flare ups.
summary: A type of arthritis found in some people who have *psoriasis*, a chronic skin disease. Generally, *psoriasis* is present for years before arthritis develops but rarely, joint problems can preceed the skin lesions.
name: psoriatic-arthritis
title: Psoriatic Arthritis

description: Also called __Enterobiasis__ or __Oxyuriasis__, this highly contagious infection is caused by the worm *Enterobius vermicularis*. It spreads from human to human by contact with contaminated surfaces such as bed sheets, clothes, towels, furniture or food. This infection is harmless, but can cause itching and restless sleep.
summary: Infection with pinworms. It is the most common worm infection in the developing world.
name: pinworms
title: Pinworms

description: __Eustachian Tube Dysfunction__ is caused by mucus or fluid buildup, typically from a virus, allergies or sinus infection.
summary: A blockage of the *eustachian tube*, a structure that connects the upper throat to the middle ear. It allows for drainage of the middle ear.
name: eustachian-tube-dysfunction
title: Eustachian Tube Dysfunction

description: __Atrophic Vaginitis__ is caused by a reduction of estrogen levels, most commonly found after menopause. Simple and effective treatments are available.
summary: Progressive inflammation, thinning, and drying of the vaginal wall. Common symptoms include vaginal dryness and pain with sexual intercourse.
name: atrophic-vaginitis
title: Atrophic Vaginitis

description: __Peripheral Vascular/Arterial Disease (PAD)__ is caused by atherosclerosis, or plaque buildup, in the blood vessels. Risk factors include diabetes, smoking, obesity, high blood pressure and high cholesterol.
summary: A condition where peripheral blood vessels are blocked or narrowed by plaques or fatty buildup. It most commonly affects the arteries in the legs.
name: peripheral-vascular-disease-(peripheral-arterial-disease-or-pad)
title: Peripheral Vascular Disease (Peripheral Arterial Disease or PAD)

description: __Endometrial Hyperplasia__ is most often caused by excess estrogen without progesterone.
summary: A thickening of the lining of the uterus (*Endometrium*) which can result in abnormal bleeding.
name: endometrial-hyperplasia
title: Endometrial Hyperplasia

description: __Cushings Syndrome__ is caused by either an overproduction of cortisol or over-exposure to cortisol (mainly from corticosteroid medications).
summary: A condition where there is too much cortisol, a hormone produced by the adrenal gland. Also known as __Hypercortisolism.__
name: cushings-syndrome-(hypercortisolism)
title: Cushings Syndrome (Hypercortisolism)

description: __Interstitial Lung Disease__ occurs as a result of exposure to toxins, like asbestos, or an autoimmune disease, as in *Rheumatoid Arthritis* or *Scleroderma.*
summary: A group of lung diseases which have scarred lung tissue as a characteristic. When the scarring starts, it is typically irreversible.
name: interstitial-lung-disease
title: Interstitial Lung Disease

description: __Paronychia__ occurs when the skin around the nail is damaged and infection gets into the surrounding tissue. Most commonly this happens to people who bite their nails.
summary: An infection in the soft tissue around the nail. It can involve either a finger or a toe.
name: paronychia
title: Paronychia

description: The exact cause of __Colorectal Polyps__ is unknown although risk factors include having Crohn's Disease or Ulcerative Colitis, having a family history of colon cancer or colorectal polyps, being over 50 and obese, and having uncontrolled type 2 Diabetes.
summary: An abnormal tissue growth in the lining of the bowel. It is a risk factor for developing colon cancer. Also known as __Rectal Polyps__ or __Colon Polyps.__
name: colorectal-polyp
title: Colorectal Polyp

description: __Vocal Cord Paresis__ is caused by damage to the nerves which supply the muscles of the vocal cords. This can be due to injury, infection or as the result of certain neurologic conditions.
summary: A condition in which there is a partial or total loss of nerve supply to the vocal cord, which causes weakness until the vocal cord is completely paralyzed.
name: vocal-cord-paresis
title: Vocal Cord Paresis

description: __Pertussis__ is caused by the bacteria *Bordetella pertussis.* It can affect people of all ages but can be prevented by vaccination.
summary: A respiratory infection which produces a severe, uncontrollable cough. It is highly contagious. Also known as __Whooping Cough.__
name: pertussis-(whooping-cough)
title: Pertussis (Whooping Cough)

description: __Condyloma Accuminata__, or Genital Warts__, is caused the *human papillomavirus (HPV)* and transmitted through sexual contact.
summary: A sexually transmitted disease causing warts in the genitals. It is highly contagious. Also known as __Genital Warts.__
name: condyloma-accuminata-(genital-warts)
title: Condyloma Accuminata (Genital Warts)

description: __Lyme disease__ is caused by the bacterium *Borrelia burgdorferi*. The highest incidences are in the northeast and upper midwest of the United States, although it is spreading to other parts of the US.
summary: Also called __Borreliosis__, this is a bacterial infection transmitted to humans through the bite of an infected blacklegged deer tick. It is the most common tick-borne infectious disease in the United States. If left untreated, infection can spread to joints, the heart, and the nervous system.
name: lyme-disease
title: Lyme Disease

description: __Hypertension__ is either __Primary Hypertension__ or __Secondary Hypertension__. __Primary Hypertension__ has no detectable cause and tends to develop gradually. __Secondary Hypertension__ forms rapidly and is a result of another underlying condition, such as kidney disease, adrenal tumors, obstructive sleep apnea, thyroid problems and medications.
summary: A chronic medical condition in which the force of blood running through arteries is consistently too high. By itself it is typically asymptomatic, but over years it can produce serious medical diseases, including heart attack and stroke.
name: hypertension
title: Hypertension

description:
__Dyslipidemia__ may be directly caused by a dysfunction of the body's metabolism of lipids, but in many cases it is a secondary result of other medical conditions, such as *diabetes*, *obesity* and *smoking*.
Unbalanced __dyslipidemia__ is considered to be a risk factor for *cardiovascular disease*, or CVD, such as a *heart attack*.
summary: A condition where blood levels of fatty substances, or *lipids* are outside of their normal limits. These lipids include *triglycerides* and the various forms of *cholesterol* in the bloodstream.
name: dyslipidemia
title: Dyslipidemia

description: For knee pain resulting from acute trauma, structural damage may have occurred to a ligament, tendon, meniscus, or bone. Common causes of knee pain following acute trauma include: meniscus tear, ligament tear (ACL, MCL, LCL), patella tendon tear, patella dislocation, and knee bone fracture.Non-traumatic knee pain may be a result of overuse, degenerative changes, crystal arthropathy, infection, or an underlying rheumatological condition. Common causes of non-traumatic knee pain include: quadriceps or patellar tendinopathy, bursitis, patellofemoral pain syndrome, osteoarthritis, gout, and pseudogout.
summary: Knee conditions frequently require physical examination and/or radiologic studies for diagnosis.
name: orthopedic-knee-conditions
title: Orthopedic Knee Conditions

description: Ankle pain is most commonly due to ankle sprain. An ankle sprain is an injury to the ligaments of the ankle.
summary: Ankle conditions frequently require physical examination and/or radiologic studies for diagnosis.
name: orthopedic-ankle-conditions
title: Orthopedic Ankle Conditions

description: Hip pain may be a result of degenerative changes, structural abnormalities, infection, nerve impingement, or trauma. The most common conditions resulting in hip pain include trochanteric bursitis (inflammation of the fluid-filled sac at the outside point of the hip), osteoarthritis, and fractures. Lateral femoral cutaneous nerve entrapment, also known as meralgia paresthetica, may also result in numbness, tingling, and/or burning sensation in the thigh region.
summary: Hip conditions frequently require physical examination and/or radiologic studies for diagnosis.
name: orthopedic-hip-conditions
title: Orthopedic Hip Conditions

description: Shoulder pain may be a result of trauma, overuse, or degenerative changes. Causes of shoulder pain following acute trauma include: rotator cuff tear, shoulder dislocation, shoulder separation, and fracture. Additional causes of shoulder pain include rotator cuff tendinopathy, adhesive capsulitis (frozen shoulder), shoulder subluxation, and arthritis.
summary: Shoulder conditions frequently require physical examination and/or radiologic studies for diagnosis.
name: orthopedic-shoulder-conditions
title: Orthopedic Shoulder Conditions

description: Common causes of elbow pain include: medial epicondylitis (\u201cGolfer\u2019s Elbow\u201d), lateral epicondylitis (\u201cTennis Elbow\u201d), olecranon bursitis, and biceps tendinopathy.
summary: Elbow conditions frequently require physical examination and/or radiologic studies for diagnosis.
name: orthopedic-elbow-conditions
title: Orthopedic Elbow Conditions

description: The most common finger injury is a finger sprain. A sprain is an injury to the ligaments of the joint. Acute trauma may also result in finger dislocation or fracture.
summary: Finger conditions frequently require physical examination and/or radiologic studies for diagnosis.
name: orthopedic-finger-conditions
title: Orthopedic Finger Conditions
